thread.title: Embattled Jeremy Corbyn LOSES IT when asked whether he will still be Labour leader in 2020
thread.title_full: Embattled Jeremy Corbyn LOSES IT when asked whether he will still be Labour leader in 2020

title: Embattled Jeremy Corbyn LOSES IT when asked whether he will still be Labour leader in 2020
text:
Jeremy Corbyn was asked about the embarrassing Copeland defeat I've given you a very, very clear answer. Yes Jeremy Corbyn 
His bizarre outburst shows further signs, a string of embarrassing failings are beginning to take their toll on the floundering leader. 
It comes after Mr Corbyn finally admitted he bore some responsibility for the loss of a seat it had held for more than 30 years to the Conservatives. 
The Conservative Party 's victory was the first by-election gain by a governing party since 1982. 
In a stumbling speech to Scottish Labour's spring conference the UK leader also admitted last week's humiliating by-election defeat to the Tories in Copeland was "disappointing". Corbyn looks crushed following by-election defeat Fri, February 24, 2017 Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn leaves his home following a humiliating blow by the Conservatives after snatching Copeland in a by-election victory. The struggling politician was talking on the day his party lost a by-election to the government, the first time this has happened in over 30 years. Adam Gray / SWNS.com 1 of 10 Jeremy Corbyn is seen at Savoy Place in London where the Labour leader was giving a speech on Brexit REUTERS Corbyn speaks during the Scottish Labour's spring conference 
But he insisted: ‚ÄùBut now is not the time to retreat, to run away or to give up." 
The beleagured Labour leader also attempted to rally the party faithful in Perth claiming its policies are "needed more than ever" as he launched an attack on Nicola Sturgeon's SNP government. PA Corbyn attempted to rally the party faithful in Perth 
Mr Corbyn insisted it had "a record to be ashamed of" listing a litany of failures on NHS, education, and transport, as he warned "there is no appetite" for another independence referendum. Related articles
